definitions.title: Simple Present Tense
definitions.definition: Used for habitual or regular actions.
definitions.example: Example: I play tennis every Sunday morning.
definitions.explanation: ‘Play’ is in the simple present tense because it shows a regular activity.

definitions.title: Simple Present Tense (Plural Subject)
definitions.definition: Used when describing actions that happen regularly.
definitions.example: Example: They go to church on Sundays.
definitions.explanation: ‘Go’ is in simple present tense, expressing a habitual action.

definitions.title: Simple Past Tense
definitions.definition: Used to describe actions that happened in the past.
definitions.example: Example: Jane wore her blue jeans yesterday.
definitions.explanation: ‘Wore’ is the past tense of ‘wear’, showing an action already completed.

definitions.title: Simple Future Tense
definitions.definition: Used to describe actions that will happen in the future.
definitions.example: Example: The bell will ring 30 minutes from now.
definitions.explanation: ‘Will ring’ shows that the action has not yet occurred but will happen soon.

definitions.title: Present Perfect Tense
definitions.definition: Used to describe actions that began in the past and continue to the present.
definitions.example: Example: I have been awake for half an hour.
definitions.explanation: ‘Have been’ connects the past and present states of being awake.

definitions.title: Present Perfect Tense (Experience)
definitions.definition: Describes an action that started in the past and is still true now.
definitions.example: Example: My father has driven the same car for ten years.
definitions.explanation: ‘Has driven’ indicates an action that started ten years ago and continues today.

definitions.title: Past Perfect Tense
definitions.definition: Used to describe an action completed before another past action.
definitions.example: Example: They had spoken to her before.
definitions.explanation: ‘Had spoken’ means the action was finished before another event.

definitions.title: Future Perfect Tense
definitions.definition: Describes an action that will be completed before a future time or event.
definitions.example: Example: I will have arrived with the keys by the time you come in.
definitions.explanation: ‘Will have arrived’ shows the action will be done before another future event.

definitions.title: Adjectives
definitions.definition: Describe nouns or pronouns to give more information about them.
definitions.example: Example: Someone in my class lent me a wonderful story.
definitions.explanation: ‘Wonderful’ is an adjective describing the noun ‘story’.

definitions.title: Adjective Clause
definitions.definition: A dependent clause that describes a noun.
definitions.example: Example: The house that is so beautiful sits atop the hill.
definitions.explanation: ‘That is so beautiful’ is an adjective clause describing ‘house’.

definitions.title: Adjective Phrase
definitions.definition: A group of words that describe a noun or pronoun.
definitions.example: Example: Sandra responded in a very rude way.
definitions.explanation: ‘In a very rude way’ is an adjective phrase describing how Sandra responded.

definitions.title: Adjective Phrase (Prepositional)
definitions.definition: Prepositional phrases can also act as adjectives.
definitions.example: Example: The tour guide talked about the buildings of the 19th century.
definitions.explanation: ‘Of the 19th century’ modifies ‘buildings’, telling which ones.

definitions.title: Adverb Clause (Concession)
definitions.example: Example: Although Tricia works hard, she always welcomes extra projects.
definitions.explanation: ‘Although Tricia works hard’ is an adverb clause showing contrast.

definitions.title: Adverb Clause (Comparison)
definitions.definition: Used to compare two ideas or situations.
definitions.example: Example: Andrew is thinner than he was the last time.
definitions.explanation: ‘Than he was the last time’ compares Andrew’s current and past state.

definitions.title: Adverb Clause (Time)
definitions.example: Example: Should we go save seats after you buy some popcorn?
definitions.explanation: ‘After you buy some popcorn’ tells when the action will happen.
